{{Infobox person | name = Erich Erber | image = Erich Erber, founder of Biomin.jpg | alt = Erich Erber, founder of Biomin | caption = Erber in 2016 | birth_name = Erich Erber | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1953|4|30}} | birth_place = [[Sankt Pölten]], [[Lower Austria]], [[Austria]] | occupation = [[Entrepreneur]] }}
'''Erich Erber''' (born April 30, 1953) is an Austrian entrepreneur. He is the founder of Erber KG, later known as [[Biomin]] GmbH; the animal health and nutrition company specializes in [[feed additives]] and premixes. It continues to be family-owned and operated.
== Early life and education == Erich Erber was born on April 30, 1953 in [[Sankt Pölten]], the capital of the state of [[Lower Austria]], and was raised on a small farm in the Mostviertel region. <ref name="derstandard_ref1">{{cite web|title=Bezwinger giftiger Pilze: Vom Bauernkind zum Weltmarktführer|url= https://derstandard.at/2000049137462/Erich-Erber-Bezwinger-der-giftigen-Schimmelpilze|last=Kainrath|first=Verena|date=12 December 2016|website= www.derstandard.at |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
He studied agriculture at the [[Francisco Josephinum]] Secondary College and Research Institute, obtaining the equivalent of a high school diploma in 1975. <ref name="ernstyoung_ref2">{{cite book | date=January 2015 |title= Der Kosmopolit aus dem Pielachtal |publisher= Enterpreneur – Magazin für unternehmerische Exzellenz by Ernst & Young (Wirtschaftsprüfungsgesellschaft m.b.H.)}}</ref>
From 1976-1978, Erich Erber worked as an Operations assistant at Kettaneh Pt Ltd, located in [[Accra]], [[Ghana]]. He was involved in the production of construction materials. At the same time, he acquired expertise in the field of international trade while majoring in export sales at the Vienna University of Economics and Business from 1978-1980. Concurrently, he began to study macroeconomics at the [[University of Vienna]] (without obtaining a degree). From 1980 - 1982, he was the Head of Sales at Chemagrar, a subsidiary of Werfft Chemie, which specializes in feed additives for the Central European compound feed industry. <ref name="derstandard_ref1"></ref><ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref>
He received his MBA, with a focus on strategic marketing, from the [[University of Hull]] in [[Singapore]].
== Biomin == In 1983, Erich Erber and Margarete Erber founded [[Biomin]] GmbH together in Pottenbrunn, Lower Austria. The company’s first products were developed in a former slaughterhouse. <ref name="allaboutfeed_ref3">{{cite web|title=Erich Erber leads Biomin from fun to serious business|url= http://www.allaboutfeed.net/Process-Management/Feed-Safety/2011/10/ErichErber-leads-Biomin-from-fun-to-serious-business-AAF012377W/|last=ter Beek|first=Vincent|date=3 October 2011|website= www.allaboutfeed.net |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref name="erbergroup_ref4">{{cite web|title=Erber Group's History|url= http://www.erber-group.net/en/about/history/|website= www.erber-group.net |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref> It continues to be family-owned and operated.
Biomin GmbH acquired Interpremix, a company with its own tank mixer and the product Antitox<sup>®</sup> Plus, in 1985. Following extensive research, the product was developed further under the name Mycofix<sup>®</sup> and subsequently became a global benchmark product. <ref name="derstandard_ref1"></ref><ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref>
One year later, it was exported to [[Asia]] for the first time. In 1988, Biomin GmbH concluded a research agreement with the [[University of Veterinary Medicine Vienna]]. Its goal was to continue to improve Antitox<sup>®</sup> Plus’s effectiveness in deactivating a wide variety of [[mycotoxins]]. <ref name="derstandard_ref1"></ref><ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref><ref name="pigsite_ref5">{{cite web|title=Biomin to Launch Mycofix 5.0 Mycotoxin Risk Management Solution to Date|url= http://www.thepigsite.com/swinenews/39083/biomin-to-launch-mycofix-50-the-most-complete-mycotoxin-risk-management-solution-to-date/|date=4 March 2015|website= www.thepigsite.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
== Erber Group == In 1992, Erich Erber founded Biomin’s first subsidiary with a local partner in [[Kuala Lumpur]]. In later years, additional subsidiaries were created abroad: examples include the first Biomin production site in [[Vietnam]] in 1995 and regional headquarters which opened in Singapore and the U.S. in 1997. In 1996, Erber AG was also founded as an [[unlisted public company]]; it was a [[holding company]] for the two group members at the time as well as for all future organizations. <ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref>
By creating an interdisciplinary in-house research team, Erich Erber established another forward-thinking milestone. Research and development have been part of Biomin’s key cornerstones ever since. <ref name="derstandard_ref1"></ref><ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref>
The next step on his path to success took place when he acquired Romer Labs [[Missouri]] in 1999. In doing so, he was able to develop a business segment that was completely new: diagnostics in the field of feed and food safety. Romer Labs thus became the second division of Erber Group.<ref name="romerlabs_ref6">{{cite web|title=Romer Labs writes history|url= https://www.romerlabs.com/en/about/history/|website= www.romerlabs.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
In 2004, Erich Erber created the Biomin World Nutrition Forum, with the goal of actively involving customers and promoting trust in the organization. Scientists, customers and managers come together to exchange ideas regarding current developments. It takes place once every two years, with approximately 800 participants (event organizers, keynote speakers, etc.). <ref name="efeedlink_ref7">{{cite web|title=The 2016 World Nutrition Forum: Driving the protein economy towards a new horizon|url= http://www.efeedlink.com/contents/06-06-2016/81232398-6635-44ff-9965-bff3aa6692a3-a181.html|last=Brooks|first=Eric J.|website= www.efeedlink.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref name="engormix_ref8">{{cite web|title=World Nutrition Forum 2004|url= https://en.engormix.com/MA-poultry-industry/events/world-nutrition-forum-2004-t115.htm|website= www.engormix.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
In 2005, Mr. Erber took additional steps to ensure the group’s development by opening the first Biomin Center of Applied Animal Nutrition. <ref name="allaboutfeed_ref9">{{cite web|title=Biomin opens Erber Research Center in Thailand|url= http://www.allaboutfeed.net/Raw-Materials/Articles/2014/12/Biomin-opens-Erber-Research-Center-in-Thailand-1673626W/|last=Koeleman|first=Emmy|date=30 December 2014|website= www.allaboutfeed.net |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref name="koenigshofer_ref10">{{cite web|title=Kooperationspartner BIOMIN|url= http://www.koenigshofer-futtermittel.at/links.html|website= www.koenigshofer-futtermittel.at |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
Erber Group’s third and fourth divisions joined in 2007: Sanphar, a Brazilian company specializing in animal health, and EFB. EFB, together with the subsidiary Bio-ferm, focuses on innovative [[Biopesticides|biotechnological pesticides]] and their research, international registration and marketing. <ref name="efeedlink_ref11">{{cite web|title=SANPHAR Asia: A 360° modern animal health company|url= http://www.efeedlink.com/contents/07-30-2015/1eb09500-0ea5-4a71-8449-d15b335b2e57-b852.html|last=Chan|first=Ngai Meng|date=30 July 2015|website= www.efeedlink.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
The construction of a state-of-the-art [[yeast]] [[fermentation]] facility in Brazil has been the group’s largest investment thus far; it became operational in 2010. This site makes direct shipments to regional markets possible. <ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref>
Erber Group sees itself as an organization of experts and is the global market leader in mycotoxin risk management, its original core business. <ref name="aquafeed_ref12">{{cite web|title=BIOMIN World Nutrition Forum 2012|url= https://issuu.com/international_aquafeed/docs/iaf1206_w1/46|last=Davies|first=Simon|date=7 November 2012|website= issuu.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref name="poultryworld_ref13">{{cite web|title=Biomin launches first purified enzyme against fumonisins|url= http://www.poultryworld.net/Nutrition/Articles/20131/3/Biomin-launches-first-purified-enzyme-against-fumonisins-1193301W/|date=7 March 2013|website= www.poultryworld.net |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
The high-performance research and development within the group provides a basis for the development of customer-oriented and innovative solutions. This is made possible, in particular, by cooperating with renowned universities and research centers on various projects. <ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref><ref name="biomin_ref14">{{cite web|title=Research - at the heart of BIOMIN|url= http://www.biomin.net/en/about/research/|website= www.biomin.net |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref name="tfztulln_ref15">{{cite web|title=Business at Technopol Tulln|url= http://www.tfz-tulln.at/magazin/00/artikel/149325/doc/d/BIOMIN%20Research%20Center.pdf?ok=j|website= www.tfz-tulln.at |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref name="fishsite_ref16">{{cite web|title=BIOMIN to Open New Aquaculture Research Center in Viet Nam|url= https://thefishsite.com/articles/biomin-to-open-new-aquaculture-research-center-in-viet-nam|last=Towers|first=Lucy|date=14 January 2015|website= thefishsite.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
Erber Group is now one of the global leaders in the field of food and feed safety. Headquartered in [[Inzersdorf-Getzersdorf|Getzersdorf]], Lower Austria, it specializes in natural [[feed additives]], feed and food analyses as well as [[crop protection|plant protection]]. In the 2017 financial year, it generated sales revenues of over 325 million Euros. Erber Group consists of [[Biomin]], Romer Labs, Sanphar and EFB. Including its sales partners, it is represented in over 120 countries. Erber Group’s annual growth can be attributed to two important success factors: the group’s international orientation and its internal research and development. <ref name="ernstyoung_ref2"></ref><ref name="erbergroup_ref17">{{cite web|title=Erber Group Companies|url= http://www.erber-group.net/en/about/erber-group-companies/|website= www.erber-group.net |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
Today, Erich Erber is the main stockholder and chairman of the Erber AG advisory board. The Erber family owns all of the companies' stocks; they are not traded on any stock market.
== Awards and Honors == In 2012, Erich Erber was awarded the title of “honorary consul” for his long-term cooperation with [[University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, Vienna |BOKU]], the University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, Vienna. <ref name="boku_ref18">{{cite web|title=Gaudeamus igitur anlässlich von Ehrungen|url= https://alumni.boku.ac.at/dl/NrOqJKJkMmJqx4KJK/14_01.pdf|date=1 March 2014|website= alumni.boku.ac.at |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
[[Ernst & Young]] designated him as “Entrepreneur Of The Year” in 2014<ref name="ey_ref19">{{cite web|title=Österreichische Top-Unternehmer ausgezeichnet|url= http://www.ey.com/at/de/newsroom/news-releases/ey-2014-eoy-press-release|website= www.ey.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>; in 2015 he received the “Expat of the Year Award” from the Foreign Trade Organization (AWO) of the [[Austrian Federal Economic Chamber]] (WKO) <ref name="wko_ref20">{{cite web|title=2015 export award winners: Expat Award for Erich Erber, Erber Group|url= http://www.advantageaustria.org/international/zentral/news/aktuell/20150818_Exportpreis-Sieger_Erich_Erber.en.html|date=18 August 2015|website= www.advantageaustria.org |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>. Furthermore, in 2015 he received an honorary PhD from [[Kasetsart University]] in [[Bangkok]]. <ref name="meinbezirk_ref21">{{cite web|title=Erich Erber mit Ehrendoktorwürde der Kasetsart Universität Thailand geehrt|url= https://www.meinbezirk.at/herzogenburgtraismauer/wirtschaft/erich-erber-mit-ehrendoktorwuerde-der-kasetsart-universitaet-thailand-geehrt-d1222470.html|date=24 January 2015|website= www.meinbezirk.at |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
On June 21, 2016, Erich Erber was awarded the “Silver Commanders’ Cross for Recognition of Services on Behalf of the State of Lower Austria” by the Governor of Lower Austria, [[Erwin Pröll]], during a ceremony in the Lower Austrian Parliament. In doing so, the state of Lower Austria recognizes Mr. Erber’s contributions and achievements as the founder and co-owner of Erber AG, which has been his [[wikt:raison d'être|raison d'être]] for more than 30 years. <ref name="iv_ref22">{{cite web|title=Ehrenzeichen für Erich Erber|url= https://niederoesterreich.iv.at/de/news/mitgliedernews/2016/ehrenzeichen-fur-erich-erber|date=22 June 2016|website= niederoesterreich.iv.at |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
In July 2017, the [[Singapore Economic Development Board]] (EBD) appointed him as the “Economic Ambassador of Singapore” for medium-sized companies. <ref name="chemanager_ref23">{{cite web|title=Neue Singapur-Wirtschaftsbotschafter für den Mittelstand |url= http://www.chemanager-online.com/themen/industriestandorte/neue-singapur-wirtschaftsbotschafter-fuer-den-mittelstand|date=11 July 2017|website= www.chemanager-online.com |accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>

{{DEFAULTSORT:Erber, Erich}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Austrian businesspeople]]

revision.comment: Undid revision 812255401 by [[Special:Contributions/203.213.22.127|203.213.22.127]] ([[User talk:203.213.22.127|talk]]) - that may be a list of sequencers, but this should be the one that the group uses.
revision.text:
'''Farbrausch''', or '''Farb-rausch''', is a [[Germany|German]] group of [[demogroup|demomakers]] who became well known in the [[demoscene]] in December 2000 with a [[64k intro]] called "fr-08: .the .product". The demo achieved its small size through the use of [[procedural textures]], a custom MIDI-based [[software synthesizer]] V2 (controlled through a sequencer called [[Logic Audio]]), and a modified version of [[UPX]] executable compressor,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soyoucode.com/2011/coding-giant-under-microscope-farbrausch |title = Coding a giant under the microscope: Farbrausch}}</ref> ".the .product" is an 11-minute [[3D computer graphics|3-D]] show featuring complex scenes of [[computer generated imagery]].
Their work has won numerous awards. In 2004, a subdivision of farbrausch called "'''.theprodukkt'''" released a 96kB first-person shooter game named "[[.kkrieger]]", and an earlier version of the [[demomaker|tool]] they currently use to produce some of their demos, named "[[.werkkzeug]]", or "Tool".
Farbrausch gives their releases a "product code", in the format "fr-0#". The numbers do not specify the order of release — the members have stated that they allocate the numbers as they start working on the project, not when they finish it. Non-serious releases receive negative numbers.
The group has periodically released improved compositions such as "fr-019: Poem to a Horse", "fr-030: Candytron" or "fr-025: The.Popular.Demo". ''The.Popular.Demo'' and ''debris.'' are among the most highly favored demos on the demoscene index, [[Pouët|Pouet]]. The.Popular.Demo also received the "Public Choice Award" from the 2003 scene.org awards, and ''debris.'' won the 2007 scene.org award for best direction.
In 2009, Farbrausch released [[.detuned]], an interactive demo for the [[PlayStation 3]], again under the name .theprodukkt.
In 2012 Farbrausch released the [[source code]] of many of their demotools on [[github.com]].<ref>[https://github.com/farbrausch/fr_public fr_public] on github.com</ref>
== Notable demo releases and awards ==

revision.comment: removed parent category of [[Category:Theory of constraints]]
revision.text:
'''Focused improvement''' in the Theory of Constraints is an ensemble of activities aimed at elevating the performance of any system, especially a business system, with respect to its goal by eliminating its constraints one by one and by ''not'' working on non-constraints.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Focused improvement|url = http://informationquickfind.com/f/fo/focused_improvement.html|website = informationquickfind.com|accessdate = 2015-11-02}}</ref>
'''Focused improvement''' can also be defined in simpler terms as a process that identifies the systems problems and then modifies the whole system in order to find the most cost effective,time saving and least disruptive solutions in order to optimize the system.
'''"Focused Improvement''' is the process of applying systematic problem solving methods to manufacturing. The process relies on aligning the correct method to the correct scenario".
== Development and Apparition == Focused improvement was developed as a working part of the Theory of Constraints management philosophy by [[Eliyahu M. Goldratt]] in his 1984 book titled ''[[The Goal (novel)|The Goal]]'', that is geared to help organizations continually achieve their goals. Unlike other popular performance improvement methods, such as [[Total quality management|TQM]] or [[Business process reengineering|reengineering]], '''F.I.''' focuses on solving real life problems and not on increasing the costs and distractions for the management's attention.
== Focused improvement V.S. Total Quality Management (TQM) == No general agreement has been reached about the characteristics of F.I. or TQM but to some extent we can observe similar traits in implementations of these processes.
=== Traits of Focused improvement === # Identify the system's constraint(s). # Decide how to exploit the system's constraint(s). # Subordinate everything else to the above decision(s). # Elevate the system's constraint(s). # Communicate the new approach and move to the next improvement<ref>{{Cite web|title = Focused Improvements for Management Methods|url = http://www.manageprojectsbetter.com/focused-improvements.html|website = Mark Waldof Consulting LLC|accessdate = 2015-11-02}}</ref>
=== Traits of TQM === # "Quality is defined by customers' requirements." # "Top management has direct responsibility for quality improvement." # "Increased quality comes from systematic analysis and improvement of work processes." # "Quality improvement is a continuous effort and conducted throughout the organization." These two philosophies have the same main goal but they go about achieving it two different ways. The Fi delivers short term results that can be translated into long term success if the process is repeated correctly without allowing it to lose momentum. The TQM has at its base client satisfaction but it only yields long term results. When choosing one of these two processes management has to take into account what are the company needs.
== Uses and potential == Products that are based on embedded computer systems has seen a rapid increase. During this time the features that are controlled or supported by software systems that are embedded have suffered an increase in their role becoming crucial. All these developments make it necessary to create and innovate new approaches for software process improvement that focus on improving specific product traits.<ref>{{Cite journal|title = Product Focused Process Improvement: Experiences of Applying the PROFES Improvement Methodology at DRÄGER|url = http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=2A0769CB6F04B48AE8DC14EBBEB3304F?doi=10.1.1.136.8336&rep=rep1&type=pdf|author=Adriana Bicego, Pieter Derks, Pasi Kuvaja, Dietmar Pfahl|citeseerx=10.1.1.136.8336|date=1999}}</ref>
Focused improvement can be used not only in business systems but in any type of system be it healthcare, education, waste management, space exploration systems(NASA etc.)
== Functioning principles == The FI is based on the [[Thinking processes (theory of constraints)|Five Thinking Processes]] that enable it to work in any cognitive system. The working principle of the five thinking processes is represented by the users ability to answer the following questions: # ''What to change?'' # ''What to change it into?'' # ''How to cause the change?'' # ''Why Change?'' # ''How to maintain the process of ongoing improvement ?'' If all questions have an answer then the Focused improvement<ref>{{Cite web|title = focused improvement «|url = http://www.kcts.co.uk/blog/tag/focused-improvement|website = www.kcts.co.uk|accessdate = 2015-11-02|last = Oxton|first = Lee}}</ref> can be applied with relative ease
== Useful quotes<ref>{{Cite web|title = http://www.tpmconsulting.org/english_show.php?id=8|url = http://www.tpmconsulting.org/english_show.php?id=8|website = www.tpmconsulting.org|accessdate = 2015-11-02}}</ref> == "Focused improvement includes all activities that maximize the overall effectiveness of equipment, processes, and plants through uncompromising elimination of losses'''*''' and improvement of performance."<ref>Suzuki, T., Ed. (1994). TPM in Process Industries. Portland, OR, Productivity Press.Tajiri, M. and F. Gotoh (p.1992). TPM Implementation - A Japanese Approach. New York, McGrawHill.</ref>
The objective of Focused Improvement is to assure that the equipment maintains a peak performance all the time.
"The fact is machines do virtually 100 percent of the product manufacturing work. The only thing we people do, whether we’re operators, technicians, engineers, or managers, is to tend to the needs of the machines in one way or another. The better our machines run, the more productive our shop floor, and the more successful our business."<ref>Leflar, J. (2001) p.15. Practical TPM. Portland, OR, Productivity Press.</ref>
The driving concept behind Focused Improvement is bringing your losses as close to zero as possible.
"Maximizing equipment effectiveness requires the complete elimination of failures, defects, and other negative phenomena – in other words, the wastes and losses incurred in equipment operation."<ref>Nakajima, S. (1988) p.19 Introduction to Total Productive Maintenance. Cambridge, MA, ProductivityPress.</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Focused Improvement}} [[Category:Theory of constraints]]

{{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = Georgy Khizha | native_name = Гео́ргий Хижа́ | caption = | office = [[Deputy Prime Minister of Russia|Deputy Prime Minister]] | term_start = 20 May 1992 | term_end = 10 May 1993 | alongside = | president = [[Boris Yeltsin]] | primeminister = Boris Yeltsin
[[Yegor Gaidar]] (acting)
[[Viktor Chernomyrdin]] | pronunciation = | birth_name = Georgy Stepanovich Khizha | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1938|05|02}} | birth_place = [[Ashgabat]], [[Turkmen SSR]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | citizenship = | nationality = [[Russia]]n | occupation = | profession = Factory manager | known_for = }} '''Georgy Stepanovich Khizha''' ({{lang-ru|Гео́ргий Степа́нович Хижа́}}; born 2 May 1938, [[Ashgabat]], [[Turkmen SSR]]) was a Russian politician and business manager who was one of the [[Deputy Prime Minister of Russia|Deputy Chairmen of the Government of the Russian Federation]] during the early years of [[President of Russia|President]] [[Boris Yeltsin]]'s administration. ==Early work== A factory manager, by 1990 Khizha was in charge of the "[[Svetlana (company)|Svetlana]]" . PJSC Svetlana (Russian: ПАО «Светлана») is a company based in [[Saint Petersburg]], [[Russian Federation]].It is primarily involved in the research, design, and manufacturing of electronic and microelectronic instruments. Svetlana is part of [[Ruselectronics]]. The name of the company is said to originate from the words for 'light of an electric lamp' (световые лампочки накаливания). From 1991 until 1992, he served as that city's deputy mayor under [[Anatoly Sobchak]], and proved to be a competent administrator.[[#Medvedev2002|Medvedev (2002)]], p. 27[[#Gaidar1999|Gaidar (1999)]], p. 173Shogren, Elizabeth (29 September 1992). [http://articles.latimes.com/1992-09-29/news/wr-177_1_political-order/3 Next Step : Russia Mixing Business With Politics : The influential industrialist class emerges as a powerful voice in the new order]. ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''. Retrieved 6 September 2017.Erlanger, Steven (27 April 1992). [https://www.nytimes.com/1992/04/27/world/in-st-petersburg-a-fight-over-power-and-property.html In St. Petersburg, a Fight Over Power and Property]. ''[[The New York Times]]''. Retrieved 6 September 2017. ==Career in government== In May 1992, Khizha was appointed as the [[Deputy Prime Minister of Russia|Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation]] for the industrial sector,[http://www.kolumbus.fi/taglarsson/dokumentit/jeltsin.htm CABINET - YELTSIN - 6.11.1991-23.12.1992]. Retrieved 6 September 2017. on recommendation to President [[Boris Yeltsin]] from Sobchak and [[Yegor Gaidar]]. Khizha was also apparently considered as an alternative for the post of acting [[Prime Minister of Russia]], along with fellow vice premier [[Vladimir Shumeiko]], as opposed to Yeltsin's nominee, Gaidar.Sneider, Daniel (10 December 1992). [https://m.csmonitor.com/1992/1210/10061.html Yeltsin's Prime Minister Rejected by Legislators, Darkening Reform Bid]. ''[[Christian Science Monitor]]''. Retrieved 7 September 2017. He was regarded as being a conservative,[https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/123246323/ 2 conservatives fired in purge by Yeltsin]. ''[[Arizona Republic]]''. Published 12 May 1993. Retrieved 6 September 2017. and his appointment was viewed as a slowdown in economic reforms.[http://www.deseretnews.com/article/231286/RUSSIAN-SAYS-DEMOCRATS-ARE-FALTERING.html RUSSIAN SAYS DEMOCRATS ARE FALTERING]. ''[[Deseret News]]''. Published 10 June 1992. Retrieved 6 September 2017. During fighting between militants in [[North Ossetia]], President Yeltsin appointed him as the acting governor of the region. He promoted to use Russians troops for the ethnic cleansing of the Ingush population in North Ossetia during the Ossetian - Ingush conflict.[https://m.csmonitor.com/1992/1103/03073.html Yeltsin Declares Emergency in Caucasus]. ''[[Christian Science Monitor]]''. Published 3 November 1992. Retrieved 6 September 2017. During this time, [[Martin Shakkum]], later one of the candidates during the [[1996 Russian presidential election]], worked with Khizha as his adviser.[http://www.heritage.org/node/20549/print-display Who's Who in the Russian Presidential Election]. [[Heritage Foundation]]. Published 6 June 1996. Retrieved 6 September 2017.[http://www.cs.ccsu.edu/~gusev/russian/msbio.html Martin Shakkum]. [[Central Connecticut State University]]. Retrieved 6 September 2017. Due to the negative economic effects of Khizha's proposals, he came into conflict with [[Anatoly Chubais]], in charge of the country's [[Privatization in Russia|economic policies]]. He was dismissed from his post in May 1993, lasting a little less than a year.[http://www.deseretnews.com/article/289776/YELTSIN-DISMISSES-2-TOP-OFFICIALS.html YELTSIN DISMISSES 2 TOP OFFICIALS]. ''[[Deseret News]]''. Published 11 May 1993. Retrieved 6 September 2017.[https://www.rulers.org/russgov.html Russian ministries, political parties, etc]. Rulers.org. Retrieved 6 September 2017. ==Sources== ===References=== {{reflist|2}} ===Books=== * {{cite book |last1 = Gaidar |first1 = Yegor |title = Days of Defeat and Victory |publisher = [[University of Washington Press]] |location = |year = 1999 |isbn = 978-0295978239 |url = |ref = Gaidar1999 }} * {{cite book |last1 = Medvedev |first1 = Roy |title = Post-Soviet Russia: A Journey Through the Yeltsin Era |publisher = [[Columbia University Press]] |location = |year = 2002 |isbn = 978-0231106078 |url = |ref = Medvedev2002 }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Khizha, Georgy}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:20th-century Russian politicians]] [[Category:Deputy heads of government of the Russian Federation]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Ashgabat]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]]

{{for|the English footballer|Ian Dalziel (footballer)}} {{Use British English|date=February 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} '''Ian Martin Dalziel''' (pronounced "Dee-ell") (born 21 June 1947) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] businessman and politician who served one term as a [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] [[Member of the European Parliament]] from 1979 to 1984.<ref name=mep>{{cite web| url = http://www.europarl.europa.eu/members/archive/alphaOrder/view.do?language=EN&id=895 | title = Ian M. Dalziel | accessdate = 18 August 2010 | publisher = ''[[European Parliament]]''}}</ref>
Dalziel was educated at [[Stewart's Melville College|Daniel Stewart's College]] in [[Edinburgh]], [[St John's College, Cambridge]], studying as a postgraduate at the [[Université Libre de Bruxelles]] and [[London Business School]]. He worked for Mullens & Co from 1970, before moving to a management position at Manufacturers Hanover Ltd. In 1978 he was elected as a Conservative to [[London Borough of Richmond|Richmond-upon-Thames Council]] for [[Barnes, London|Barnes]] Ward.
His involvement in international business led him to seek election to the [[European Parliament]] at the first election in 1979, and he was unexpectedly elected for the [[Lothians (European Parliament constituency)|Lothians constituency]] which included his birthplace of [[Edinburgh]]. He stood down after one five-year term. due to pressure of business: in 1983 he had become the co-founder of Adam & Company, a start-up private bank subsequently acquired by Royal Bank of Scotland, and following a merger, became chairman of Continental Assets Trust plc.
In 1989 Dalziel became a director of Lepercq-Amcur Fund NV, and he has chaired the board of C.S.I., Inc., since 1992. He was appointed to the board of Precision Systems Inc. in 1996. In 1998 he was a defendant in a dismissed class action suit by shareholders of Precision Systems.
==References== {{reflist}}

page.title: Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan

revision.text:
{{Infobox accounting body |name_in_local_language = انسٹی ٹیوٹ اف چارٹرڈ اکاونٹینٹ اف پاکستان |abbreviation = ICAP |image = Emblem of ICAP.jpg |image_border = |alt = Creating Opportunities Globally |predecessor = <!-- Name of any predecessor entity if any --> |formation = {{Start date and years ago|1961|07|01}} |legal_status = [[Body corporate]] established under The Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961 that was promulgated by the [[President of Pakistan]] |objective = Regulate the [[financial audit|auditing]] and accounting profession in [[Pakistan]] |headquarters = [[Karachi]] |membership_num = 8819 |students_num = >100,000 |members_designations = ACA (Associate) and FCA (Fellow) |language = [[English language|English]], [[Urdu]] |highest_officer_title = President |highest_officer_name = Riaz A. Rehman Chamdia |second_officer_title = Vice President (North) |second_officer_name = Jafar Husain |third_officer_title = Vice President (South) |third_officer_name = Farrukh Rehman |fourth_officer_title = <!-- position of the fourth ranking officer like Treasurer etc.. --> |fourth_officer_name = <!-- name of the above person --> |administering_organ = Council |IFAC_membership_date = October 7, 1977 |additional_data_name1 = Offices |additional_data1 = [[Karachi]], [[Lahore]], [[Islamabad]], [[Peshawar]], [[Multan]], [[Faisalabad]], [[Gujranwala]], [[Sukkur]], [[Quetta]], [[Mirpur, Azad Kashmir]] and [[Hyderabad, Sindh|Hyderabad]] |additional_data_name2 = |additional_data2 = |additional_data_name3 = |additional_data3 = |num_staff = |website = {{url|www.icap.org.pk}} |Online Forum = {{url|www.capakistan.org}} |remarks = |Colours = [[Light Green]], [[White]]}}
'''Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan''' (ICAP) is a professional [[accountancy]] body in [[Pakistan]]. {{As of|July 2016}}, it had 8,819 members working in and outside Pakistan.<ref>[http://www.icap.org.pk/web/links/134/memberstatistics.php ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080621191634/http://www.icap.org.pk/web/links/134/memberstatistics.php |date=June 21, 2008 }}</ref> The institute was established on July 1, 1961 to regulate the profession of accountancy in Pakistan. It is a statutory autonomous body established under the Chartered Accountants Ordinance 1961. With the significant growth in the profession, the CA Ordinance and Bye-Laws were revised in 1983.
In view of globalization of the accountancy profession, the Institute is in the process of updating the Ordinance and Bye-Laws once again.
The course of ICAP involves a blend of theoretical education and practical training which run concurrently for a period of 3.5 years and equips a student with knowledge, ability, skills and other qualities required of a professional accountant.
The head office of the institute is in [[Clifton, Karachi]] where it has its own premises. The institute also has regional offices at [[Lahore]], [[Islamabad]], [[Peshawar]], [[Multan]], Gujranwala, Sukkur, Quetta, Mirpur (AJK), [[Faisalabad]] and [[Hyderabad, Sindh|Hyderabad]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.icap.org.pk/icap/contact-us/|title=The Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan » Communication with Institute|website=www.icap.org.pk|access-date=2016-03-17}}</ref>
==History==
===1850–1881=== In Indian subcontinent there were a few British firms of accountants, but they were so busy that their services were not available to the general public. The public companies used to appoint a European auditor for safeguarding the interests of the European shareholders, and an Indian auditor with the objectives of safeguarding the interests of the Indian shareholders. The audit of financial statements were conducted under the Companies Act 1850.<ref name="kas">Saeed, Prof. Dr. Khawaja Amjad, Auditing: Principles & Procedures, Lahore: Institute of Business Management, 1993 pages 18–22.</ref>
===1882–1913=== Then the Companies Act of 1885 was passed. Regulations 83–94 of Table A contained in the First Schedule provided for the audit of accounts of the companies adopting that table and for the appointment, remuneration and duties of the auditors. In those times, it was not necessary for an auditor to be a qualified accountant. Companies used to employ lawyers as their auditors.<ref name="kas"/>
===1913–1932=== <!-- [[WP:NFCC]] violation: [[Image:GDA Certificate.png|thumb|200px|Government Diploma in Accountancy Certificate]] --> On 1 April 1914, the Companies Act, 1913 was passed and it was necessitated that every auditor of a public limited company must be a certified auditor by the government. The provincial governments were empowered to grant auditors' certificates but, at the same time, the central government also reserved the right to recognise members of certain professional bodies as qualified auditors without obtaining Auditor's Certificate from the government. Consequently, the members of the English, Scottish and Irish Institutes of Chartered Accountants and the English [[Society of Incorporated Accountants and Auditors]] were recognised as qualified auditors.
At that time there was no provision of any kind for the training and examination of the accountants. Government of Bombay was the first provincial government to take a constructive step in the direction of organising the profession. In 1918, it instituted the Government Diploma in Accountancy called GDA and made regulations for the examination and training of those who wanted to obtain that Diploma and certificate to practise.
An Accountancy Board was set up by the Government and was attached to the Sydenham College of Commerce and Economics, Bombay. This functioned till 1932. The Board was required to register apprenticeships and conduct the required examinations. The successful candidates were granted the GDA Diploma and they could practise if they had previously received training as apprentices with a practising accountant. The Accountancy Board was also required to advise the Government on all matters relating to accountancy and the Government.<ref name="kas"/>
===1932–1947=== In 1932, the Government framed rules under Section 144 of the companies Act, 1913, called Auditors' Certificates Rules, 1932. The objectives of the rules, broadly, were to register apprenticeships, to conduct examinations, and to control and regulate the profession of auditing. The accountancy profession was then being supervised and controlled by the Ministry of Commerce of the Central Government. With a view to helping the Government in discharging the necessary responsibilities in respect of the accountancy profession, Indian Accountancy Board was established. The Board consisted of officials and practising accountants nominated by the Government. Later, in 1939, appointment of a majority of the members on the Board was made on the elective principle. The Board was only an advisory body. The Auditors' Certificates Rules, 1932, required the passing of two examinations – Registered Accountants first and final. It further laid down the tenure of the prescribed training which was required to be completed during the period of apprenticeship. Provisions meant to regulate and control the profession were also contained therein.<ref name="kas"/>
===1947–1984=== After independence, Pakistan adopted the Auditors' Certificates Rules 1932 with certain amendments in 1950, and thus the auditing profession was administered under the Auditors' Certificates Rules, 1950. The Rules of 1950 were generally based on the old rules with some amendments incorporated therein. A person who passed the Registered Accountants first and final examinations and who satisfied the Ministry of Commerce, Central Government of Pakistan that he had completed the prescribed practical training could have his name placed on the register maintained by the said Ministry and was entitled to use the designation 'Registered Accountant' (RA). The Companies Act, 1913, as adapted by Pakistan allowed only a Registered Accountant to act as the auditor of a public limited company, although his services could also be utilised for the audit of private companies, partnership, etc.
In 1952, the Registered Accountants formed a private body known as 'Pakistan Institute of Accountants' with the object of looking after their own interest and taking up with the Ministry of Commerce, Government of Pakistan, matters affecting the accountancy profession.
In June 1959 the Department of Accountancy was established in the Ministry of Commerce with a Controller of Accountancy to deal with the profession instead of a Section Officer.
During this period, an advisory body called the 'Council of Accountancy' was set up under Auditors' Certificates Rules, 1950 and recommended the establishment of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Pakistan. The Government accepted the recommendations and the Department of Accountancy assisted by the officials of the Institute and a number of its members prepared the Draft Ordinance to be passed.
The Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961, received the assent of the President of Pakistan, Field Marshal General Ayub Khan on March 3, 1961 and was published in Part 1 of the Extraordinary Gazette of Pakistan on March 10, 1961. The Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan came into being on July 1, 1961. A draft of the Chartered Accountants Bye-Laws was also prepared and published for inviting public comments. The amended version called the Chartered Accountants Bye-Laws, 1961 was published in the Part 1 of the Extraordinary Gazette of Pakistan on July 1, 1961 and was enforced as on that date. As of that date the Department of Accountancy and the Pakistan Institute of Accountants having served a very useful purpose for a long time were finally liquidated.
The Chartered Accountants Bye-Laws provided for the formation of regional committees to look after the interests of their members. The members are divided into two classes – namely, Associate Chartered Accountants (ACA) and Fellow Chartered Accountants (FCA).<ref name="kas"/>
[[File:ICAP Logo .jpg|thumbnail|ICAP Logo for Chartered Accountancy Qualification and Profession in Pakistan. And it was introduced in 2013-14]]
===1984-till now=== In December 1984, the Companies Act, 1913 was replaced by the Companies Ordinance, 1984 with an order by the President of Pakistan General Zia-ul-haq. With this Ordinance, it was also necessitated for the manufacturing concern to prepare and maintain cost accounting records and to arrange cost audit on annual basis by a Chartered Accountant or a Cost and Management Accountant. It also lays down the requirements for the preparation of financial statements of unlisted companies. For listed companies the above Ordinance also made mandatory the National Accounting Standards (NAS) and other standards to be strictly followed while preparing financial statements.
Keeping in view the convergence, undergone by the major economies of the world such as United States of America, China and Canada, of the International Financial Reporting Standards with respective local GAAP, the demand for IFRS specialists is increasing. The Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan (ICAP) has introduced a diploma in IFRS to prepare the candidates to avail such opportunities.
<ref>http://www.icap.org.pk/icap/our-vision-our-mission/</ref>
==Presidents and members== Past Presidents till present are as follow; {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year !! Past Presidents !! Organization |- | 1961–1962|| S. Osman Ali || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1962–1963 || M. Ahmad || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1963–1966 || Waqas Aslam || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1966–1969 || Vaqar Ahmed || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1969–1970 || A. Rab || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1970–1972 || V. A. Jafarey || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1972–1973 || M. Yakub || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1973–1975 || Ejaz Ahmed Naik || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1975–1978 || Abdur Raouf Shaikh || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1979 || Aftab Ahmed Khan || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1979–1983 || H. U. Beg || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1983–1986 || Irtiza Husain || [[Ministry of Finance (Pakistan)]] |- |1986–1988 || [[Ebrahim Dahodwala]] || [[BDO International]] Pakistan |- |1988–1989 || M. Afzal Munif || BKR International Pakistan |- |1989–1991 || Ebrahim Sidat || [[Ernst & Young]] Pakistan |- |1991–1992 || Abdul Hameed Chaudhri || Hameed Chaudhri & Company |- |1992–1993 || Khalid Rafi || [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]] Pakistan |- |1993–1994 || Muhammad Yousuf Adil || [[Deloitte]] Pakistan |- |1994–1996 || Syed Masoud Ali Naqvi || [[KPMG]] Pakistan |- |1996–1997 || Sajjad Ahmad || [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]] Pakistan |- |1997–1998 || Ahmad Dawood Patel || [[Ernst & Young]] Pakistan |- |1998–1999 || Najam I. Chaudhri || [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]] Pakistan |- |1999–2000 || Shaukat Amin Shah || ICAP Members Exclusive |- |2000–2001 || Pir Mohammad A. Kaliya || First Paramount Modaraba |- |2001–2002 || A. Husain A. Basrai || [[KPMG]] Pakistan |- |2002–2003 || Khaliq-ur-Rahman || [[Grant Thornton]] Pakistan |- |2003–2004 || Mujahid Eshai || CHARTAC BUSINESS SERVICES (PVT) LTD |- |2004–2005 || Zafar Iqbal Sobani` || [[Hub Power Company]] |- |2005–2006 || Syed Mohammad Shabbar Zaidi || [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]] Pakistan |- |2006–2007 || Nasimuddin Hyder || [[Ernst & Young]] Pakistan |- |2007–2008 || Imran Afzal || [[Grant Thornton]] Pakistan |- |2008–2009 || Syed Asad Ali Shah || [[Deloitte]] Pakistan |- |2009–2010 || Abdul Rahim Suriya || A.R.Suriya& Co, Chartered Accountants |- |2010-2011 || Shaikh Saqib Masood || [[KPMG]] Pakistan |- |2011-2012 || Rashid Rahman Mir || Rusell Brad Ford Pakistan |- |2012-2013 || Ahmad Saeed || Mazars Consulting |- |2013-2014 || Naeem Akhtar Sheikh || HASSAN NAEEM & CO |- |2014-2015 || Yacoob Suttar || ASIA PETROLEUM |- |2015-2016 || Hafiz Mohammad Yousaf || NCBMS Consulting |- |2016-2017 || Nadeem Yousuf Adil || [[Deloitte]] Pakistan |}
The member statistics till 2010 are as follows; {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Area of occupation !! North region !! South region !! Total |- | Commerce and Industry || 1,179 || 983 || 2,161 |- | Corporation || 9 || 4 || 13 |- | Education || 37 || 38 || 75 |- | Financial Institution / Banks || 297 || 90 || 388 |- | Government || 24 || 21 || 45 |- | Employed in Practice || 237 || 182 || 419 |- | Non-Practice (Overseas) || 779 || 353 || 1,132 |- | Public-Practice (Overseas) || 16 || 3 || 19 |- | Public-Practice (Domestic) || 290 || 358 || 648 |- | Others (Overseas) || 9 || 1 || 10 |- | Others (Domestic) || 81 || 21 || 102 |- | Life Member || 43 || 23 || 66 |}
Five year Statistical Data of Members {| class="wikitable" |- | '''Year''' || 2006 || 2007 || 2008 || 2009 || 2010 || 2011 || 2012 || 2013 || 2014 || 2015 || 2016 |- | '''Members''' || 3,864 || 4,110 || 4,243 || 4,709 || 5,078 || 5,305 || 5,589 || 6,082 || 6,400 || 6,720 || 7,141 |} <ref name="kas"/> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.icap.org.pk/wp-content/uploads/annualreports/anuallreport2013.pdf |format=PDF |title=Symbolising Growth :Annual Report 2013 |publisher=Icap.org.pk |accessdate=2015-03-10}}</ref>
==Student== The Institute provides students the login tab on its website.<ref>http://www.icap.org.pk/my-student/</ref> The Institute committed to regulate the education, training and examination of its students in order to ensure that a newly qualified Chartered Accountant can continue to be confidently regarded as:
* Having a sound grounding in the major subject of accountancy, business, finance and management which can be further developed by continuing education and which can be drawn on for a professional lifetime; * Being fully equipped with the professional attitudes expected of a member of the Institute; * Being ready to undertake work, demanding qualities and skills expected of a chartered accountant and being able, with suitable induction, speedily to acquire any additional accountancy skills required for particular task in public practice, industry, commerce or else where.
From 1994 a Pre-entry Proficiency Test (PPT) was introduced to determine the suitability of candidates before being registered as Trainee Students/Full Time Students. PPT was mandatory for all entrants except those who were exempt from PPT but later when new policy was introduced in 2014, it was completely excluded from the course.
==Publications== The publications of the Institute are: * Coffee Table Book * Newsletter * The Pakistan Accountant * MIES * Technical E-Newsletter
The Pakistan Accountant is the professional flagship publication of the Institute. It is intended to serve as a forum for disseminating information on auditing and accounting practices, business and finance, and topics of current national and international interest.
The Newsletter is designed to provide a heads-up on important Institute events and activities. The Pakistan Accountant and the Newsletter have received a makeover this past year to boost the Institute’s professional image, and to serve as a channel for staying in touch with our most valuable assets – our members and students.
Through the Members Information & Education Series (MIES) the Institute hopes to promote the integration of best practices and sound judgment among members.
These publications form the body of literature that fosters the Institute’s policy of promoting education and research.<ref>http://www.icap.org.pk/icap/publications/</ref>
==International association== The ICAP is a member of [[International Federation of Accountants]] (IFAC), [[International Accounting Standards Board]] (IASB), [[Confederation of Asian and Pacific Accountants]] (CAPA) and [[South Asian Federation of Accountants]] (SAFA). ICAP was awarded associate membership by [[Chartered Accountants Worldwide]] (CAW), making it the second professional body to be admitted to the organisation since its launch in February 2013.<ref>http://economia.icaew.com/news/february-2016/icap-joins-chartered-accountants-worldwide</ref>
==See also== *[[Association of Chartered Certified Accountants]] *[[International Federation of Accountants]] *[[Institute of Cost and Management Accountants of Pakistan]] *[[Pakistan Institute of Public Finance Accountants]] *[[Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan]]
==Notes== {{Reflist}}
==References== * Saeed, Prof. Dr. Khawaja Amjad (1993), ''Auditing: Principles and Procedures'', Lahore: Institute of Business Management. * ICAP Coffee Table Book, ''A journey through time'', And it can be viewed using this link, ''http://www.icap.org.pk/wp-content/uploads/CoffeeTable/CTB/index.html#p=14''
==External links== *[http://www.icap.org.pk/ Official homepage] *[http://www.capakistan.org/ Official Blog] *[http://www.icap.org.pk/web/links/0/listoffirmshavingsatisfactoryqcrrating.php Firms having satisfactory QCR Rating in Pakistan] *[http://www.accountancy.com.pk Pakistan Accountancy Forum Official Website] *[http://www.ifacnet.com/ IFACnet – A KnowledgeNet for Accountants in Business] {{coord missing|Pakistan}} {{IFAC Members}}

link to state party, replaced: [[Australian Labor Party| → [[Australian Labor Party (New South Wales Branch)| using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=April 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox Politician |honorific-prefix = |name = John Beveridge |honorific-suffix =[[Justice of the Peace|JP]] | image = John Beveridge JP Alderman for Redfern 1889.jpg | office = 15th [[Municipality of Redfern|Mayor of Redfern]] | term_start = 12 February 1891 | term_end = 29 May 1891 | predecessor = [[Thomas Clarke (New South Wales politician)|Thomas Clarke]] | successor = George Howe | office1 = [[Alderman]] on the [[Municipality of Redfern|Redfern Municipal Council]] | term_start1 = 20 September 1886 | term_end1 = 29 May 1891 | predecessor1 = [[Francis Augustus Wright]] | successor1 = [[William Poole (Australian politician)|William Poole]] | constituency1 = Belmore Ward | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1848|08|08}} | birth_place = [[Windsor, New South Wales|Windsor]], [[New South Wales|Colony of New South Wales]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1916|03|15|1848|08|08}} | death_place = [[Randwick, New South Wales|Randwick]], New South Wales, Australia | party = [[Free Trade Party]] | relations = | spouse = Priscilla Wright (1853–1929) | children = | residence = | occupation = Merchant and businessman | alma_mater = | religion = Presbyterian | signature = }} '''John Beveridge''', [[Justice of the Peace|JP]] (8 August 1848{{spaced ndash}}15 March 1916) was a New South Wales businessman, sportsman and local government politician, who served as an Alderman (1886–1891) and [[Municipality of Redfern|Mayor of Redfern]] (1891).
==Early life and background== Beveridge was born 8 August 1848 in the town of [[Windsor, New South Wales|Windsor]], [[New South Wales|Colony of New South Wales]]. He was the son of John Beveridge, a baker and [[Confectionery|confectioner]], and Jane Greig, who as assisted migrants had emigrated from [[Kirkcaldy]], [[Fife]], [[Scotland]], to Sydney on 16 January 1839. At the age of 19, Beveridge entered the mercantile firm of ''George Griffiths and Co.'' in 1867. On 8 August 1871 he was married to Priscilla Wright, the [[Anglo-Irish]] daughter of teacher and later principal of the [[Sydney Teachers College|Fort Street Training School]] John Wright (1822–1887),<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13657570 |title=Family Notices. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=24 May 1887 |accessdate=15 April 2015 |page=1 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> at St Andrew's Presbyterian Church, Sydney, by the Rev. Robert Lewers.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13243090 |title=Family Notices. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=14 August 1871 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=1 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref name=ISN>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article63621940 |title=Leaders in Our Mercantile World. |newspaper=[[Illustrated Sydney News]] |date=22 August 1889 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=10 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Beveridge and his wife Priscilla had seven children: John Stuart (1872–1874),<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13339415 |title=Family Notices. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=20 November 1874 |accessdate=15 April 2015 |page=8 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> [[Percy Beveridge|Percy]] (1875–1947), Mabel (1878–1955), Harry (1882–1943), Violet (1886–1975), Cecil (1888–1946)<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article22252748 |title=Family Notices. |newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)|The Argus]] |location=Melbourne |date=22 June 1946 |accessdate=18 April 2015 |page=20 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> and Roy Stuart (1893–1916). In 1880 he was made a partner in the firm, and on the retirement of Griffiths became the owner, which specialised in "wholesale grocery and general merchandise" from its premises on the corner of [[Bridge Street, Sydney|Bridge]] and Young streets, Sydney.<ref name=ISN/>
A prominent member of the flourishing business community in Sydney and Redfern, Beveridge became involved as a member of the [[Sydney Chamber of Commerce]] and as a director of the Mortgage, Guarantee and Mercantile Finance Corporation of New South Wales, the Sydney Real Estate Bank and the Australian Traders' Fire Insurance Company.<ref name=ISN/> Beveridge also became a member of the Redfern Branch of the [[Free Trade Party|Free Trade Association]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13697600 |title=MEETINGS. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=24 September 1888 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> A keen sportsman, Beveridge was a member of the Cricket Union (vice-president in 1889) and was instrumental in the development of the Surry United Cricket Club, being captain from 1879 (now the Surry Hills Cricket Club).<ref name=ISN/>
==Public service== Beveridge eventually stood for office as a free trader and became an [[alderman]] unopposed on [[Municipality of Redfern|Redfern Municipal Council]] for Belmore Ward on 20 September 1886, filling a vacancy created by the departure of Alderman [[Francis Augustus Wright]], and was re-elected in February 1888.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13642295 |title=Advertising. |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald|location=NSW |date=21 September 1886 |accessdate=1 February 2016 |page=14 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13672542 |title=THE MUNICIPAL ELECTIONS AND NOMINATIONS. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=8 February 1888 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=7 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article222438175 |title=BOROUGH OF REDFERN. |newspaper=New South Wales Government Gazette |issue=550 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=28 September 1886 |accessdate=2 June 2016 |page=6578 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> In September 1888 he presided over a meeting at [[Redfern Town Hall]] to support the ultimately-unsuccessful candidacy of free trader John Martin for a by-election to the [[New South Wales Legislative Assembly]] seat of [[Electoral district of Redfern|Redfern]]; the meeting was attended by [[Henry Parkes|Sir Henry Parkes]] who also spoke in support.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13695695 |title=REDFERN ELECTION. ADDRESS BY MR. J. A. MARTIN. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=5 September 1888 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=12 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
Beveridge strongly aligned himself with the politics of Parkes and later stood for the seat of Redfern himself as a Free Trade candidate at the [[New South Wales colonial election, 1889|1889 colonial election]], but was unsuccessful, missing out by a margin of over 100 votes, despite the overall success of the Free Trade movement at that election, with Parkes forming government.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13712311 |title=Advertising |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |issue=15,868 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=30 January 1889 |accessdate=22 May 2018 |page=12 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13712655 |title=Advertising |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |issue=15,870 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=1 February 1889 |accessdate=22 May 2018 |page=13 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Green |first1=Antony |title=NSW Elections – Redfern 1889 |url=https://www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/resources/nswelectionsanalysis/1889/Redfern.htm |website=NSW Elections Index |publisher=Parliament of New South Wales |accessdate=27 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150826001442/http://www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/resources/nswelectionsanalysis/1889/Redfern.htm |archivedate=26 August 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13712299 |title=THE REDFERN ELECTORATE. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=30 January 1889 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=6 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article160793841 |title=THE ELECTIONS IN NEW SOUTH WALES. |newspaper=[[Adelaide Observer]] |location=SA |date=9 February 1889 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=37 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Even so, on 12 June 1890 he was appointed to the Redfern Sub-District Public School Board by the Governor [[Charles Wynn-Carington, 1st Marquess of Lincolnshire|Lord Carrington]], on the advice of Free Trader Minister for Public Instruction, [[Joseph Carruthers]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article219922146 |title=PUBLIC SCHOOL BOARDS. |newspaper=[[New South Wales Government Gazette]] |issue=316 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=13 June 1890 |accessdate=29 May 2016 |page=4632 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
On 12 February 1891 Beveridge was elected to be mayor of the council and was instrumental in making Redfern the first suburb in Sydney to have electricity and electric street lighting, which occurred when the Council voted unanimously in 1891, following the recommendations of the improvements committee, to build its own power station in Turner Street to power the suburb.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article114311716 |title=Advertising |newspaper=Evening News |issue=7376 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=15 January 1891 |accessdate=22 May 2018 |page=3 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13814379 |title=REDFERN. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=18 February 1891 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=4 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article113884043 |title=A Redfern Loan. |newspaper=[[The Evening News (Sydney)|The Evening News]]|location=Sydney |date=24 April 1891 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Beveridge then proposed and passed through council a loan of £50,000 for the purpose.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article235888446 |title=A REDFERN BOROUGH LOAN. |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |issue=3688 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=24 April 1891 |accessdate=22 May 2018 |page=4 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article235877997 |title=THE PROPOSED REDFERN LOAN. |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |issue=3691 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=28 April 1891 |accessdate=22 May 2018 |page=4 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> This movement by the council was later affirmed and protected by the [[Parliament of New South Wales]] when it passed the ''Borough of Redfern Electric Lighting Act 1895''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Borough of Redfern Electric Lighting Act 1895|url=http://www5.austlii.edu.au/au/legis/nsw/num_act/borela1895nb376.pdf|website=austlii.edu.au|publisher=Australasian Legal Information Institute|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref>
However, by May 1891 Beveridge had resigned as mayor and an alderman for Redfern prior to his candidacy for the [[New South Wales colonial election, 1891|1891 election]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article113882008 |title=Resignation of the Mayor of Redfern. |newspaper=[[The Evening News (Sydney)|The Evening News]]|location=Sydney |date=30 May 1891 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=6 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> His vacancy in Belmore Ward was subsequently filled by [[William Poole (Australian politician)|William Poole]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article222097361 |title=BOROUGH OF REDFERN. |newspaper=New South Wales Government Gazette |issue=397 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=23 June 1891 |accessdate=2 June 2016 |page=4632 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Beveridge stood again as a Free Trade candidate for Redfern, reaffirming his support for the Free Trade vision for [[Australian Federation]] and noting that overall wages in New South Wales were higher compared to Victoria and taxation was lower owing to the Free Trade system in NSW, a system "that is best for the commercial interests of the colony."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13828422 |title=REDFERN. THE FREETRADE BUNCH. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=17 June 1891 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Beveridge was however again unsuccessful at the June election which saw the Free Traders lose out to the [[Australian Labor Party (New South Wales Branch)|Labor Party]] and the [[Protectionist Party|Protectionists]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Green |first1=Antony |title=NSW Elections – Redfern 1891 |url=https://www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/resources/nswelectionsanalysis/1891/Redfern.htm |website=NSW Elections Index |publisher=Parliament of New South Wales |accessdate=27 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150826001528/http://www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/resources/nswelectionsanalysis/1891/Redfern.htm |archivedate=26 August 2015 |df= }}</ref>
==Later life== Following this defeat, Beveridge returned to business, taking up a high-ranking position in the Sydney office of the [[New York Life Insurance Company]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article66444966 |title=News in Brief. |newspaper=Windsor and Richmond Gazette|location=NSW |date=13 October 1894 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |page=3 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> On 25 November 1891, Beveridge sold his merchandise business, ''George Griffiths and Co.'' to David Cohen and Company.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article219925564 |title=Transfer of Trade-mark (registered No. 3,533) under sec. 6 of Trade-marks Act 28 Vic. No. 9. |newspaper=[[New South Wales Government Gazette]] |issue=751 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=27 November 1891 |accessdate=29 May 2016 |page=9344 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Beveridge nevertheless retained his keen interest in the Free Trade movement and in politics generally, including presiding over the election committee for [[John Neild]]'s unsuccessful bid for the seat of [[Electoral district of Woollahra|Woollahra]] at the [[New South Wales colonial election, 1894|1894 election]] (he lost to [[Adrian Knox]], standing as an 'Independent Free Trade' candidate).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13954208 |title=WOOLLAHRA ELECTORATE. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=6 June 1894 |accessdate=30 March 2015 |page=8 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> [[George Reid (Australian politician)|George Reid]]'s Free traders were successful at that election and Beveridge, in a letter to the Sydney Morning Herald, noted: "the vote of last Tuesday must inspire every thinking man in the community with the idea that the people are ripe for the establishment of a progressive policy, and I believe Mr Reid is the man for the hour."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13961124 |title=THE NEXT PARLIAMENT. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=24 July 1894 |accessdate=30 March 2015 |page=6 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
===Lithgow=== By 1896, Beveridge had opened his own retail business in the rural and mining town of [[Lithgow]] and involved himself in various community activities, including in cricket. Reporting on his attendance at a Lithgow reception for Premier Reid in May 1896, the ''[[Windsor and Richmond Gazette]]'' noted: "no doubt, ere long Mr. [Beveridge] will take a leading part in matters connected with the welfare of the town, for he is too good a man to be allowed to stay long in clover. His ability is already recognised in his new home, and a matter of a few months will decide whether he enters the Municipal arena or not. If he does, Lithgow will be the gainer."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article72548695 |title=TOPICS OF THE DAY. |newspaper=Windsor and Richmond Gazette|location=NSW |date=23 May 1896 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |page=1 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> In early 1896 Beveridge nominated to take up a vacancy on Lithgow Ward on [[City of Lithgow|Lithgow Municipal Council]], but received only 6 votes.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14036705 |title=MUNICIPAL ELECTIONS. |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |location=NSW |date=10 February 1896 |accessdate=25 January 2016 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> The next year he stood again for Lithgow Ward but lost by one vote.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article108865231 |title=MUNICIPAL ELECTIONS. |newspaper=[[Empire (newspaper)|Evening News]] |location=Sydney, NSW |date=8 February 1897 |accessdate=25 January 2016 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Beveridge became heavily involved in local cricket circles, donating the "Beveridge Cup" for district matches, and becoming President of the Lithgow District Cricket Association in 1899; the patron of the association that year was prominent local politician [[Joseph Cook]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71333288 |title=Country Clubs. |newspaper=[[Australian Town and Country Journal]] |location=Sydney, NSW |date=9 September 1899 |accessdate=25 January 2016 |page=52 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
A supporter of [[Federation of Australia|Australian Federation]], Beveridge was nominated to attend the People's Federal Convention at [[Bathurst, New South Wales|Bathurst]] in November 1896, which had convened to discuss the 1891 draft Constitution being proposed for the Commonwealth of Australia.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article156708966 |title=People's Federal Convention. |newspaper=[[The National advocate|National Advocate (Bathurst, NSW : 1889 - 1954)]] |location=Bathurst, NSW |date=18 November 1896 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> The most important recommendation made by the convention was that the [[Australian Senate|Senate]] should be directly-elected. In December 1897, Beveridge established the Lithgow Land, Building, and Investment Company and became a company director.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article108875515 |title=LITHGOW ITEMS. |newspaper=Evening News|location=Sydney, NSW |date=7 December 1897 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |page=3 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> As a longstanding [[Justice of the Peace]], on 23 January 1899 Beveridge was appointed by Governor [[Henry Brand, 2nd Viscount Hampden|Lord Hampden]], on the recommendation of Minister for Justice [[Charles Lee (Australian politician)|Charles Lee]], as [[Coroner]] for Lithgow and for the colony at large.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28250079 |title=GOVERNMENT GAZETTE. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 January 1899 |accessdate=31 March 2015 |page=5 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article220989471 |title=Government Gazette Appointments and Employment |newspaper=[[New South Wales Government Gazette]] |issue=72 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=24 January 1899 |accessdate=29 May 2016 |page=643 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
===Hay=== By 1901, Beveridge had moved again to the Riverina town of [[Hay, New South Wales|Hay]], and opened his own general merchandise store, "''Beveridge & Co.''", in the town.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article140157722 |title=Advertising |newspaper=[[The Riverine Grazier]] |issue=3452 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=16 May 1902 |accessdate=30 March 2016 |page=3 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> It was not long before Beveridge again returned to Cricketing circles, gaining much respect in the Hay Cricket Association, later serving as vice-president, and rising to be President of the Hay Chamber of Commerce in 1901.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article144653851 |title=Hay Chamber of Commerce. |newspaper=[[Riverina Times, Hay Standard and Journal of Water Conservation]] |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=10 October 1901 |accessdate=30 March 2016 |page=2 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> In February 1901, Beveridge was elected as Honorary Secretary at the inaugural meeting of the Hay Free Trade Association and later assisting in the campaign of Free Trade candidate [[James Ashton (politician)|James Ashton]] for the seat of [[Division of Riverina|Riverina]] at the [[Australian federal election, 1901|first federal election]] a month later.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article143538934 |title=FREETRADE. |newspaper=The Riverine Grazier |issue=3340 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=22 February 1901 |accessdate=30 March 2016 |page=2 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article143542414 |title=THE FEDERAL ELECTION. |newspaper=The Riverine Grazier|issue=3349 |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=29 March 1901 |accessdate=30 March 2016 |page=2 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> In May 1902 Beveridge departed Hay for a visit to [[London]] for the [[Coronation of King Edward VII and Queen Alexandra]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article86218656 |title=FROM WEEK TO WEEK. |newspaper=Windsor and Richmond Gazette|location=NSW |date=10 May 1902 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |page=3 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article144657851 |title=WISHING MR J. BEVERIDGE BON VOYAGE. |newspaper=Riverina Times, Hay Standard and Journal of Water Conservation |location=New South Wales, Australia |date=10 March 1902 |accessdate=30 March 2016 |page=2 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
===Return to Sydney=== After moving back to Sydney with his family, in later years he served as the general manager of the Merchants' and Traders' Employment Bureau, which his brother Peter had purchased in July 1908.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article85864250 |title=FROM WEEK TO WEEK. |newspaper=[[Windsor and Richmond Gazette]] |location=NSW |date=25 July 1908 |accessdate=29 March 2015 |page=3 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> The Bureau's offices were sited within the New York Mutual Life Building at 14 [[Martin Place]], Sydney.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sands Sydney, Suburban and Country Commercial Directory|url=http://cdn.cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au/learn/history/archives/sands/1910-1919/1913-part18.pdf|publisher=City of Sydney|accessdate=7 December 2015|date=1913}}</ref> Beveridge moved with his family to a new residence, "Violet" in Balfour Road, [[Kensington, New South Wales|Kensington]], but in later years his health suffered greatly owing to "acute heart trouble", which led to his death aged 67 on 15 March 1916.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article15655339 |title=Family Notices. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=17 March 1916 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=8 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article121178683 |title=DEATH OF MR. JOHN BEVERIDGE. |newspaper=[[The Referee (newspaper)|The Referee]]|location=Sydney |date=22 March 1916 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=12 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> His youngest son [[Lance sergeant]] Roy Stuart Beveridge ([[20th Battalion (Australia)|20th Battalion]]) was later killed in action following the [[Battle of Flers]] in France on 12 November 1916.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article15688792 |title=WAR CASUALTIES. |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=15 December 1916 |accessdate=28 March 2015 |page=7 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>The battlefield conditions were so muddy that they were described by the official historian, [[Charles Bean]], as "the worst ever encountered by the AIF".{{cite web|url=http://www.awm.gov.au/units/unit_11207.asp|title=20th Battalion |work=First World War, 1914–1918 units|publisher=Australian War Memorial}}</ref> His eldest son [[Percy Beveridge]] became a notable cricketer in New Zealand, while his son Cecil became an actor and theatre director and, also of the 20th Battalion, was injured during the [[Battle of Pozières]] in 1916.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article1020902 |title=PERSONAL. |newspaper=[[The Mercury (Hobart)|The Mercury]] |location=Hobart, Tas. |date=17 August 1916 |accessdate=15 April 2015 |page=6 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>Cecil Beveridge was injured later in September and was promoted to the rank of [[Warrant Officer]] Class One before receiving a medical discharge on 21 March 1920, he later worked for [[Hoyts|Hoyts Cinemas]]. [[National Archives of Australia|NAA]]: B2455, BEVERIDGE C</ref> He is interred with his wife (d. 1929) and his third son, Harry (d. 1943, who was a branch manager for the [[Commonwealth Bank]]) at [[Waverley Cemetery]].
==Notes== {{reflist|2}}
{{s-start}} {{s-civ}} {{s-bef| before= [[Thomas Clarke (New South Wales politician)|Thomas Clarke]] }} {{s-ttl |title= [[Municipality of Redfern|Mayor of Redfern]] | years =1891 }} {{s-aft|after=George Howe}} {{s-end}}

revision.text:
[[File:Joost-mller-1348345045.jpg|thumb|Joost Möller]]
''' J.H. (Joost) Möller''' (born May 20, 1967 in [[Eindhoven]]) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] politician of the [[People's Party for Freedom and Democracy]] (VVD).<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.blikopnieuws.nl/bericht/116223/Sieneke_en_Joost_M%F6ller_tokkelen_van_reuzenrad.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120724051214/http://www.blikopnieuws.nl/bericht/116223/Sieneke_en_Joost_M%F6ller_tokkelen_van_reuzenrad.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=July 24, 2012|title=Sieneke en Joost Möller tokkelen van reuzenrad|date=July 16, 2010|work=Blik op Nieuws|language=Dutch|accessdate=September 27, 2011}}</ref>
Möller was a [[councillor (NL)|councillor]] of [[Tilburg]] from 1999 to 2008. Since 2008 he has been an [[wethouder|alderman]] of this [[North Brabant]] municipality. From 2002 to 2010, he was also owner of an [[employment agency]] called ''Talentflex''.
Möller studied [[business economics]] at [[Tilburg University]].
== References == * {{nl}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20130520004857/http://www.tilburg.nl/gemeente/ep/channelView.do?channelId=-12986&displayPage=%2Fep%2Fchannel%2Ftl_channel_default_program.jsp&pageTypeId=9960 Tilburg municipality] {{Reflist}}
